_transcript.body: A transcript of the video content will be available for people whose accessibility requirements mean they prefer the content as text.

title: Media Title
displayTitle: The Public Procurement Gateway – making procurement easier
instruction: Play the video to find out more

title: Text Title
body:
Every organisation needs administrators. If you’re taking on the role of administrator for your organisation or accessing the Public Procurement Gateway as a sole trader, select Administrator.


If you will be accessing the services as a user, select User.

title: Text Title
body:
Before you finish, here are some takeaway reference guides that provide step-by-step support on the key areas of this learning:


Select the guides to download them


Accessing the Public Procurement Gateway as a user


The administrator role


Multi-factor authentication apps



You may now close this guide

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
displayTitle: The Public Procurement Gateway user journey
body:
In this topic you will find out:

  • what you need to access and start using the Public Procurement Gateway
  • about the role of administrator
  • how to get support

title: Narrative Title
displayTitle: How to access the Public Procurement Gateway
body: Kalvin’s company is new to the Public Procurement Gateway and he’s not sure where to begin, so he asks some advice from his colleague, Charlie, who used the service at her previous organisation.

_items.body:
“It’s really simple – to access the Public Procurement Gateway, the organisation has to be registered on the website. You can check if it’s already registered by typing in the name. Looks like we’re not registered yet.”


Select the forward arrow to find out more

“Okay, next step. Every organisation needs an administrator, who is responsible for managing information and user access to the services. 


If you’re not the administrator, and won’t be taking on that role, you can still register the organisation and nominate someone else to fulfil the administrator role – so, are you happy to be the administrator, Kalvin?”

title: Flip Card Title
displayTitle: What do I need to do to get started?
body: Setting yourself up as an administrator is a simple process.
instruction: Select each card to find out more

_items.backText:
Access


Begin by accessing the Public Procurement Gateway on the Crown Commercial Service website, or by using a link that was sent to you in an email inviting you to register.

Verification


You then provide your organisation details for verification. You’ll be advised on how to find the information required.

Authentication


Administrators must complete an authentication process. You will have a choice of using your individual email address or an authenticator app on your mobile device.

title: Accordion Title
body: There are 2 methods for authenticating yourself on the Public Procurement Gateway.
instruction: Select each heading to find out more

_items.body:
Multi-factor authentication applications, or MFA apps for short, are commonly used by organisations for their built-in security features.


You can download an MFA app to a device, like your mobile phone.


Once you’re registered as an administrator using your individual email address, you can use the MFA app on your device to log into your account securely.


Google Authenticator and Microsoft Authenticator are widely used and free, but any recognised MFA app will work. 


Make sure you use the multi-factor authenticator app you've downloaded to your device and not a QR code reader (a QR code reader may not work by itself).


Most importantly, keep the authenticator app on your device, or you’ll have to restart the registration process all over again.
_items.title: Multi-factor authentication application (MFA app)
Email
_items.body: If you choose email as your authentication process, each time you log in you will receive an email with a code which you would then use to authenticate yourself on the Public Procurement Gateway.

If you are going to access the Public Procurement Gateway on a regular basis, we recommend you use the MFA app, if you are able to use one.


Once set up, an MFA app is quicker and easier to use.
_items.title: Which should I choose?

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body:
We recommend as best practice, you:

  • set up a group administrator mailbox 
  • ensure all administrators have access to the group mailbox
  • share the group administrator email address within your organisation 
  • action requests in your group administrator mailbox

title: Dialog Title
displayTitle: How many administrators should we have?
body: A few weeks later Kalvin discusses this question with Charlie.

_items.body: Hi Charlie, Thanks for helping me get started with the administrator role, it’s going really well. I only get a small number of requests each month as people start or leave the business.

But as you’ve probably heard, the business is likely to expand over the next few months – and I’m taking leave at the end of the year. I’m not sure what happens next… Who can pick up the administrator tasks while I’m away?

Hey Kalvin! We should always have at least 1 other administrator to help in situations just like this. In our case, it’s probably best that you assign administrator access to a number of other colleagues as soon as possible, to ensure cover during periods of absence. Do you have anyone in mind that you can nominate?
As a matter of fact, I do… a couple of people actually. But how many of us should there be?

Well, the number required should be determined by the size of the organisation, so be sure to think about the business expansion when making your decision. Like I said, it’s best practice to ensure there’s a minimum of 2… just in case.
Thanks Charlie, that makes sense.

No problem at all. One more thing – it would be a good idea to set up a centralised mailbox for the new administrator group. It will help to ensure consistency and contingency moving forwards, as all requests are kept in 1 place where all the administrators can view and action them.
That's a great tip. Thanks!

title: Checklist Title

_items.title: make sure you have all the information you need to register
download a multifactor authentication app to your device if needed
notify colleagues that you are the administrator and a point of contact for queries regarding the Public Procurement Gateway
set up a group mailbox for administrator-related communications
log into the Public Procurement Gateway and give access to users and any additional administrators

body: Check-off each of the actions below:

title: Flip Card Title
body: You’ve registered as the administrator for your organisation – what do you need to do next?
instruction: Select each card to find out more

_items.backText: Inform colleagues that you’re the administrator and the point of contact for the Public Procurement Gateway.
Add users, groups, and other administrators to the Public Procurement Gateway as needed.
We recommend that you set up a group mailbox to manage administrator communications in your organisation.

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body:
This guide for the new Public Procurement Gateway has been designed to streamline procurement services for both buyers and suppliers.


You’ll find out what the Public Procurement Gateway is, where to find it, and how it works. You’ll also find out how to access it and, if you are going to be the administrator, how to register and manage tasks.

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
displayTitle: Accessing the Public Procurement Gateway dashboard
body:
To begin, your organisation must first be registered. To do this, go to the Public Procurement Gateway on the Crown Commercial Service website.


Once you’ve registered, you’ll have access to your Public Procurement Gateway dashboard, which will include the relevant services you need.

title: Text Title
displayTitle: Are you going to be an administrator?
body:
If you know who your administrator is, you can request user access from them directly, or through the Public Procurement Gateway, and await approval.


However, if you're going to be an administrator for the Public Procurement Gateway, select the button below to visit the administrator role section of this learning.


If you will be a user, continue to scroll down this page.

title: Text Title
body:
If you know who your administrator is, you can request user access from them directly, or through the Public Procurement Gateway, and await approval.


If you already know who your administrator is, select the button below.

Otherwise, continue to scroll down this page.

title: Do we have an administrator?
body: Hiba is trying to access the Public Procurement Gateway for the first time and isn’t sure whether their organisation has already registered an administrator, so she messages her colleague, Charlie.

_items.body: Hi Charlie, I don’t know if we have an administrator for the Public Procurement Gateway. Do you know how I can find out?

Hi Hiba, it’s a really simple process! If you haven’t been contacted by your administrator, or you’re unable to find out if your organisation has one, you can check by entering the organisation’s details.
You won’t be told who the administrator is prior to your registration (for data protection reasons), but a notification will be sent to them requesting you be given user access.
What happens then?
The administrator will receive your access request. They’ll then approve the request and give you the appropriate level of access to the Public Procurement Gateway.
How would I be notified?
You’ll receive an email notification requesting you to log in using a link. But please be mindful – the link will expire after 36 hours and can only be clicked once.
The good news is that Kalvin is getting set up as the administrator, so you can contact him directly!
I’ll message him now. Thanks Charlie!

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
displayTitle: I have accessed the Public Procurement Gateway; what do I do now?
body:
Once you have accessed the Public Procurement Gateway, you will see your dashboard where the services available to you will be displayed. 


As the dashboard is developed, further services relevant to you will be added.

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body: If you have any queries or issues regarding the Public Procurement Gateway, you should first contact your administrator(s) for support.

title: Checklist Title

_items.title: check that you’re registered as a user
bookmark/save the access point to the Public Procurement Gateway

body:
Make sure you’re all set up and able to confidently access the Public Procurement Gateway.


Check-off each of the actions below

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body:
... you will learn about the administrator role, exploring how to register and sign into the Public Procurement Gateway.


Every organisation requires at least 1 administrator – it’s an important role.

title: Narrative Title
displayTitle: What is my role as an administrator?
body: Kalvin’s just offered to take on the role of administrator for his organisation, and Charlie is explaining what his responsibilities will be.

_items.body:
"It’s all very straightforward. As an administrator, you’ll be responsible for managing user access and information within the organisation, so that those who need to can access the Public Procurement Gateway."


Select the forward arrow to find out more
“You’ll be maintaining user information, keeping users and groups up to date as people join or leave, resetting passwords, and deciding what level of access users will need.”
“Great, thanks Charlie! I’ll make a quick list of those tasks now.”

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body:
Consider having more than 1 administrator to ensure you have cover for absences. The number of administrators you’ll need will depend on the size of your organisation.


Administrators can combine this role with their other work tasks.

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body:
If you choose authentication by email, always use an individual email address.


This ensures the authentication code goes only to the person who requires it, preventing confusion and security issues.

title: Checklist Title

_items.title: download an MFA app on your mobile device if needed
make sure there are enough administrators in your organisation to manage requests and cover absences
let colleagues know that you are the point of contact for any administrative Public Procurement Gateway queries
set up a group mailbox, ensuring all administrators have access if required

body: Check off each of the actions below to make sure you’re all set up and able to access the Public Procurement Gateway with confidence

title: Flip Card Title
displayTitle: What do I need to know about my ongoing role as an administrator?
body: As an administrator, you will have access to a number of features that help you provide support to users in your organisation.
instruction: Select each card to find out more

_items.backText: You can validate user requests to access the Public Procurement Gateway and decide what level of access is appropriate for their role.
You can reset passwords when required.
You can keep information up to date.
You can add and remove users as they join or leave the organisation.

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body:
Familiarise yourself with the quick reference guides.


It may also be helpful to set up internal communications with other areas of your organisation, such as HR and IT, to notify you of new users and leavers.

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body:
As an administrator, you might consider using group communications (for example, your intranet or newsletter) to update your Public Procurement Gateway users on key messages. 


You can also use group communications to ensure users know who to contact if they have any queries or issues.

_graphic.alt: Add Alt text description for the image here

title: Text Title
body:
Take some time to consider the best way to manage these tasks:


  • validating user requests and deciding what level of access is appropriate for their role
  • resetting passwords when required
  • keeping information up to date
  • adding and removing users as they join or leave the organisation

title: Text Title
body: Select the Home icon to return to the menu and and see Guides and Support for downloadable resources

title: Text Title
body: Select the Home icon to return to the menu and and see Guides and Support for downloadable resources
